sentence.Network_en: He was seen as truculent, temperamental, too unwilling to tolerate others.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们认为他为人蛮横无理, 性情暴躁, 不大能容人.

sentence.Network_en: It was his usual aspect, and a truculent one.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是他惯常的模样, 是一种好斗的表情.

sentence.Network_en: He was in no truculent state of mind now.
sentence.Network_cn: 这会儿他心肠一点也不狠毒了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin truculentus, from trux, truc- 'fierce'

entry.tran: 暴躁的;易怒的;好斗的;尖刻的
entry.def: If you say that someone is truculent, you mean that they are bad-tempered and aggressive.

sentences.sentence: "as truculent as a small boy who thinks his big brother can lick anybody"
"a truculent speech against the new government"
